page.title: 01OVERVIEW OF LONGSTANTON AREA
page.content: This area is made up mainly of parts of two rural parishes:{LONGSTANTON} (population 2860) and{ LOLWORTH}(130). It is bisected by the busy A604 trunk road,running NE from Cambridge to Huntington. Being almost on the edge of the Fens, the terrain is very flat, varying little in height from a mean of 15m above sea level. It is excellent arable farmland, and almost all non-residential land is under cultivation. In Longstanton there is a little light industry, but neither village provides much on-the-spot employment. Most workers commute daily to Cambridge (about 8 miles); a few go as far as London. Both villages have a high proportion of residents who are not "true village" people. Both have seen considerable building in recent years. Longstanton has a large Army barracks on its outskirts.
